created_time: April 12, 2023, 07:27:20 PMLast edit: April 13, 2023, 07:56:25 PM by cafter
content: i play slots hoping to win 'big win' or 'jackpot' but many times it don't hits and my balance get drained after betting many times in one slot machine. i play more bets hoping it already took my so much balance it will definitely going to hit this times, but it never happens, and my balance becomes "0".so i am sharing some tips to avoid this type of losing streak or bad luck in slots.here it starts:1. always set a budget for playing slots and stick to it. do not chase losses or try to win back what you have lost by playing more.2. if a slot machine does not hit in 7-10 spins, consider trying a different machine. this can help you avoid getting stuck on a losing streak and losing more money.3. if you have been playing a slot machine for 50 spins and have not gotten any free spins or big wins, consider switching to a different machine.     this can help you avoid wasting money on a machine that is unlikely to pay out.4. avoid playing slots from Pragmatic and Gamomat as they tend to have low payout percentages and are not as likely to result in big wins.5. be careful when playing slots from Belatra and Spinomenal as they can be unpredictable and may not always pay out as expected.6. if you do hit a big win, consider tipping any nearby players who may have been unlucky or busting. This can help spread good karma and keep the atmosphere positive.7. avoid getting "slot psychosis" where you get stuck on one machine for too long. remember that slots are based on random chance and there is no guaranteed way to win.     so, take breaks, switch machines and remember to have fun!8. first check the RTP (reward to player) and RTP should between 96%-100%

comments.body: These are very interesting tips that you gave, but in my point of view these tips will only make the person relax when he is having a losing streak, but the defeats will not disappear until he stops playing, he may even later have some wins, but then the losses will always outweigh the wins, the biggest problem in  Gambling that depend on luck is that the number of losses will always exceed the number of wins and the only way to do well in  Gambling that depend on luck of luck Is when the person wins a jackpot, for example if a person spends days losing and winning little and in all he loses 1000$ but later wins a jackpot of 2 million dollars then in this case he will be compensating for the time spent playingbut the problem is that there are few people who are lucky enough to win the jackpot, so most people are just losing money with  Gambling that depend on luck, I don't see any strategy that can change the current scenario of gambling that depend on luck people always have more losses than wins no matter what they do, while in sports betting, poker and other  Gambling that do not depend on luck the objective is always to have the highest number of wins and lowest number of losses and choose high odds. that's why I don't play those games that rely on luck

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: If you play slots because you want to win a lot of money, forget about it because slot games are luck-based gambling games. So if you don't have luck when you play, you can lose and the losses will get bigger if you can't control yourself.The tips you provide are very interesting but try to have limited funds so you don't exceed the money limit you use for gambling. We know that slot games really tempt us to keep trying our luck so that we can spend a lot of money. Without restrictions on using money, our losses can be bigger than we imagine.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Yes, losing is a part of gambling, and slot machines are no exception. The odds are always in favor of the casino, and the longer you play, the more likely you are to lose. So while you might have some wins here and there, over time, you're likely to lose more than you win. But, if you approach it with the mindset of having fun and setting a budget for yourself, you're less likely to get carried away and lose more than you can afford. It's all about managing your expectations and not getting too caught up in the excitement of a potential win. At the end of the day, it's just a game.
